abstract: Eleven people were convicted of roles in a counterfeiting ring that distributed pirated software around the world.
snippet: Eleven people were convicted of roles in a counterfeiting ring that distributed pirated software around the world.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  A court in southern China convicted 11 people on Wednesday of violating national copyright laws and participating in a sophisticated counterfeiting ring that for years manufactured and distributed pirated Microsoft software throughout the world.

headline.main: Chinese Court Convicts 11 in Microsoft Piracy Case
headline.print_headline: Chinese Court Convicts 11 in Microsoft Piracy Case

abstract: Some models of the Microsoft Zune, a portable media device, were hit by a glitch that caused them to freeze. Microsoft says it is working on the problem.
snippet: Some models of the Microsoft Zune, a portable media device, were hit by a glitch that caused them to freeze. Microsoft says it is working on the problem.
lead_paragraph: UPDATE 5:23 P.M.: This post has been updated to include information from Microsoft regarding the cause of the glitch.

headline.main: The Day the Microsoft Zunes Stood Still

abstract: The challenges of getting the new Yahoo Mail out the door are emblematic of the company’s struggles in 2008.
snippet: The challenges of getting the new Yahoo Mail out the door are emblematic of the company’s struggles in 2008.
lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that this has been a tough year for Yahoo. For investors, the company’s two major setbacks were the failed merger negotiations with Microsoft and the failed advertising partnership with Google, which disintegrated in the face of opposition from advertisers and the Justice Department. For many employees, much of the pain came from two rounds of layoffs, seemingly endless rounds of reorganizations and a sense that they were riding on a rudderless ship.

abstract: Ever since I increased the amount of memory inside the box, my Windows Vista PC has been crashing. Is there a way to tell if the new RAM chips are causing the problem as opposed to a virus?
snippet: Ever since I increased the amount of memory inside the box, my Windows Vista PC has been crashing. Is there a way to tell if the new RAM chips are causing the problem as opposed to a virus?
lead_paragraph: Q. Ever since I increased the amount of memory inside the box, my Windows Vista PC has been crashing off and on. Is there a way to tell if the new RAM chips are causing the problem as opposed to, say, a virus?
